subject: Climate & Environment
title: How Much Water Earth Really Has
description: One-minute skill: How Much Water Earth Really Has.

hook.text: Earth is 71% water. But 97.5% of it is salty ocean â€” undrinkable without treatment.

buildup.text: Of the remaining 2.5%, most is locked in glaciers and ice caps, out of reach.

discovery.text: Only 0.3% of all freshwater is in lakes, rivers, and accessible groundwater.

twist.text: All the rivers and lakes on Earth hold less than 1% of freshwater. Most is underground.

climax.text: 8 billion people depend on a fraction of a fraction of Earth's total water.

punchline.text: A blue planet, but almost none of it is drinkable.

quiz.question: What percentage of Earth's water is freshwater?
